Based on the user's preference cues and genre information, I would recommend "The Sixth Sense" (1999) as one potential recommendation.
"The Sixth Sense" is a psychological thriller that tells the story of Malcolm Crowe, a child psychologist who starts treating a young boy named Cole who encounters dead people. Cole convinces Malcolm to help them. In turn, Malcolm helps Cole reconcile with his estranged wife.
"The Sixth Sense" stars M. Night Shyamalan as Malcolm Crowe, Mischa Barton as Cole, Trevor Morgan as Dr. Sigmund Freud, Toni Collette as Marla Crowe, Donnie Wahlberg as Michael Crowe, Haley Joel Osment as The Spirit, Olivia Williams as Sarah Crowe, Bruce Willis as Malcolm Crowe (final scene), and Bruce Willis as Malcolm Crowe (final scene).
Overall, "The Sixth Sense" is a well-made psychological thriller that tells an engaging story with interesting characters. It's definitely worth checking out if you're interested in psychological thrillers or horror movies.
